name: lib/entry.js
lib/functions.js
executeWhenIdle
description: Based on return value of predicate, this function decides whether to execute the method immediately or in frame cycle

params.name: callback
params.description: Api func execution may be sync or Async, if its sync we cant return notifier as user can register doneCallback after API invocation

name: executeAsyncWhenIdle
description: Based on return value of predicate, this function decides whether to execute the method in immediate frame cycle or following cycle

name: trigger
description: execute all the entries

name: addFunction
description:
Add the function to entries
if trigger is in progress, adds once its completed

name: removeFunction
description:
remove the function from entries
if trigger is in progress, removes once its completed

name: functionsWillExecute
description:
Should be implemented by the class which inherits it,
will be called before executing entries

name: shouldExecuteFunctions
description:
Should be implemented by the class which inherits it,
Should be a predicate function which decides whether to execute the entries.

name: functionsDidExecute
description:
Should be extended by calling super.functionsDidExecute() by the class which inherits it,
If connector is enabled , this will trigger the function that was referenced to connector

name: setConnector
description:
sets the connector function which is the binder for next sequence of actions
if trigger is in progress, sets once its completed

name: removeConnector
description:
removes the connector function which is the binder for next sequence of actions
if trigger is in progress, removes once its completed

name: linkConnector
description:
enables the connector function which is the binder for next sequence of actions
if trigger is in progress, enables once its completed

name: unLinkConnector
description:
disables the connector function which is the binder for next sequence of actions
if trigger is in progress, disables once its completed

name: lib/helpers.js
executeInSyncOrAsync
description: Based on return value of predicate, this function decides whether to execute the method immediately or in frame cycle

params.name: callback
params.description: Api func execution may be sync or Async, if its sync we cant return notifier as user can register doneCallback after API invocation

name: executeEntries
description: Executes all the stored functions , if callLater enabled, executes them in frame cycle

params.name: entries
params.description: of  which contains the function and its context.

params.name: callLater
params.description: indicates execution needs to happen in frame cycle

return.description: return count of entries that are added to execute in loop later

name: lib/index.js

content:
# Functions
[![NPM version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@statetree/functions.svg?style=flat-square)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@statetree/functions)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.com/StateTree/functions.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.com/StateTree/functions)
[![Code Coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/StateTree/functions/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/StateTree/functions/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)

## Download

### npm
```
npm install --save @statetree/functions
```

[Docs](https://statetree.github.io/functions/docs/)

# What?
* Collection of functions which are executed in the order they are added
* An Object that helps us to add and remove function to functions collection
* Provides a connector to co-oridante each collection set

# Why?
* We need to execute few task based on some condition and task after that based on another logic, this Library will facilitate that
* for example, i want to execute all the functions that collect data from various sources followed by data cleaning task functions..
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@statetree/functions",
  "version": "6.1.0",
  "description": "cluster of function that can be chained to create a pipeline ",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "webpack-dev-server --open --mode development",
    "lint": "eslint ./src --ext .js --cache --fix --ext .jsx --cache --fix",
    "test": "./node_modules/.bin/mocha test/**/*test.js --timeout 0 --require ./node_modules/@babel/register --require test/helpers/*.js -R spec",
    "coverage": "NODE_ENV=coverage ./node_modules/.bin/nyc npm run test",
    "report-coverage": "nyc report --reporter=lcov > coverage.lcov && codecov",
    "doc": "./node_modules/.bin/esdoc open ./docs/index.html",
    "prebuild": "rimraf lib && rimraf build",
    "build": "./node_modules/.bin/webpack --mode production ",
    "postbuild": "node scripts/postbuild.js",
    "release:master": "git checkout master && git merge --squash --strategy-option theirs develop && git commit -am 'Release Commit' && git push && git checkout develop",
    "release:bugfix": "npm version patch -m 'Bumped patch version number' && npm run release:master",
    "release:feature": "npm version minor -m 'Bumped minor version number' && npm run release:master",
    "release:breakingchange": "npm version major -m 'Bumped major version number' && npm run release:master",
    "postversion": "git push origin HEAD --follow-tags"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/StateTree/functions.git"
  },
  "author": "Sanjay Krishna Anbalagan",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/StateTree/functions/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://statetree.github.io/functions/docs/",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.4.4",
    "@babel/core": "^7.4.5",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.4.5",
    "@babel/register": "^7.0.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.0.1",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.4",
    "babel-plugin-istanbul": "^5.0.1",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "co-exec": "^1.1.0",
    "codecov": "^3.5.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^5.6.1",
    "eslint-loader": "^2.1.1",
    "fs-extra": "^7.0.0",
    "ghooks": "^2.0.4",
    "jsdom": "^12.2.0",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "nyc": "^14.1.1",
    "rimraf": "^2.6.2",
    "sinon": "^7.3.2",
    "webpack": "^4.32.2",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.2",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.4.1"
  },
  "files": [
    "index.js",
    "README.md",
    "LICENSE"
  ],
  "config": {
    "ghooks": {
      "pre-commit": "npm run test"
    }
  },
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@statetree/ticker": "^3.4.1"
  }
}

* An Object that helps us to add and remove function to functions collection

content:
# How?

## API
### addFunction

```
import Functions from '@statetree/Functions';
```

### removeFunction

```

```
### trigger


### linkConnector

```
import Functions from '@statetree/Functions';
```

### unLinkConnector


### setConnector


### removeConnector

description: if function execution in progress, should remove after completion

name: it11
description: callback should be called after removing

description: trigger

description: Should execute all added functions

name: it15
description: Should execute connector after callback

description: setConnector

description: Should add new connector

name: it18
description: if we set connector in the middle of execution, connector should wait till the current trigger get completed

name: describe19
description: removeConnector

name: it20
description: Should remove the connector

name: it21

description: Should not execute connector if removed

name: it27
description: if we unlink connector in the middle of execution, connector should still execute for the current trigger and not for next trigger
